intro: Neonauclea papuana, commonly known as the Papuan neonauclea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of New Guinea. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
